snippet: The fabled cabaret will not reopen when the Algonquin Hotel does.
abstract: The fabled cabaret will not reopen when the Algonquin Hotel does.
lead_paragraph: After a 32-year run, the Oak Room, the fabled supper club and cabaret at the Algonquin Hotel in Midtown and a venue of choice for entertainers like Andrea Marcovicci, Karen Akers and Bill Charlap, will not be back when the hotel reopens in May after an extensive renovation. The Algonquin's general manager cited declining audiences in spite of "top-notch performers." Read more on ArtsBeat »

headline.main: The Oak Room Will Stay Quiet
